content: Who was the 16th President of the United States, known for leading the country through its Civil War and delivering the Gettysburg Address?

The 16th President of the United States was Abraham Lincoln. He served from March 4, 1861, until his assassination on April 15, 1865. Lincoln is indeed renowned for leading the nation through the American Civil War and delivering the Gettysburg Address on November 19, 1863. The Gettysburg Address is considered one of the most important speeches in American history, reaffirming the principles of human equality and republicanism as stated in the Declaration of Independence.
